name: Sint Maarten (Dutch part)
description: Sint Maarten (Dutch part) is an island nation in the Caribbean, characterized by its diverse landscapes, ranging from pristine beaches and coral reefs to mountainous interior regions.  It boasts a unique blend of Dutch and Caribbean cultures, reflected in its architecture, cuisine, and traditions. The island is known for its vibrant marine life, lush tropical forests, and significant historical importance as a former Dutch colony.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital and main port of entry.
quickFacts.detail: Philipsburg offers a mix of duty-free shopping, historical sites, and waterfront dining.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: A relatively small and tightly-knit community.
quickFacts.detail: The population is comprised of a mix of Dutch, Caribbean, and other international residents.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: Dual currency system reflecting the island's status.
quickFacts.detail: The Guilder is the official currency, but the NXM is widely accepted.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Dutch is the official language, but English is widely spoken.
quickFacts.detail: A significant portion of the population speaks Papiamento, a Creole language.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: A small but densely populated island.
quickFacts.detail: The island is geographically diverse, with a mountainous core and low-lying coastal plains.

quickFacts.label: Highest Point
quickFacts.description: The highest point on the island.
quickFacts.detail: Reaching 374 meters (1,227 ft), it offers panoramic views.

climateData.title: Tropical Marine Climate
climateData.description: Sint Maarten enjoys a tropical marine climate characterized by consistently warm temperatures and high humidity throughout the year. Rainfall is relatively evenly distributed, with a distinct wet season.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The hottest and most humid period, with frequent showers.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: A transitional season with decreasing rainfall and pleasant temperatures.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The coolest and driest season, with comfortable temperatures.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Temperatures begin to rise again, and rainfall increases slightly.

naturalWonders.name: Betsie's Hope
naturalWonders.description: Betsie's Hope is a dramatic coastal cliff formation located on the western side of the island.  Formed by centuries of wave erosion, it presents a stunning display of layered limestone and offers breathtaking views of the Atlantic Ocean.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The cliffs are particularly impressive during high tide, showcasing the raw power of the ocean.  The area is also home to a diverse array of seabirds and marine life.

naturalWonders.name: Washington Mountain
naturalWonders.description: Washington Mountain, the highest point on Sint Maarten, offers spectacular panoramic views of the island and surrounding Caribbean Sea. Its rugged terrain and diverse ecosystem make it a popular destination for hikers and nature enthusiasts.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The mountain is covered in lush tropical vegetation, including mahogany trees and various species of orchids.  It's also home to a variety of endemic bird species.
viewingTips: Start early to avoid the heat

ecosystemData.title: Tropical Rainforest Ecosystem
ecosystemData.overview: Sint Maarten’s interior is dominated by a tropical rainforest ecosystem, characterized by high rainfall, warm temperatures, and incredible biodiversity. This ecosystem plays a crucial role in regulating the island’s climate and providing habitat for a wide range of plant and animal species.
